org.concordion.ext.run.parallel

Class ParallelRunStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.concordion.ext.run.parallel.ParallelRunStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, org.concordion.api.listener.SpecificationProcessingListener, org.concordion.api.RunStrategy

    public class ParallelRunStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.concordion.api.RunStrategy, org.concordion.api.listener.SpecificationProcessingListener
    Runs specifications in parallel. Each specification fixture has its own instance of ParallelRunStrategy. The call(Runner, Resource, String, ResultAnnouncer, ResultRecorder) method is invoked for each child specification that the fixture executes. (this is called from the RunCommand when a concordion:run command is executed). After processing a specification, this class waits for all of the executed child specifications to complete. To avoid thread starvation, it allocates an additional thread while waiting. The thread pool is shared across all instances. Before usage, the initialise(String) method must be called to initialise the thread pool to the appropriate size.

    • Method Detail

      • initialise

        public static void initialise(java.lang.String runThreadCount)
        Initialises the thread pool.
        Parameters:
        runThreadCount - the number of threads in the thread pool. If this ends with C, the runThreadCount is multiplied by the number of cores. For example, a runThreadCount of 2.5C will allocate 10 threads when there are 4 processors available to the JVM.

      • call

        public void call(org.concordion.api.Runner runner,
                 org.concordion.api.Resource resource,
                 java.lang.String href,
                 org.concordion.internal.command.ResultAnnouncer announcer,
                 org.concordion.api.ResultRecorder resultRecorder)
        Runs a "child" specification.
        Specified by:
        call in interface org.concordion.api.RunStrategy
        Parameters:
        runner - the Concordion runner to use
        resource - the current specification resource
        href - the URL of the child specification to run. This is normally relative to the current specification resource
        announcer - announces the results to all listeners (eg. listeners that update the results in the output specification)
        resultRecorder - records the results (eg. for console output)
